pr_title: CMTS-133: If a deployment exception or lifecycle exception is thrown …

timeline.bodyText: This failure is not needed anymore since the exception will be thrown
timeline.author: lucianoRM

replies.bodyText: No, actually the way the connector has to return a "failure" is by throwing this exception which has a an error code. If any other exception is thrown we should propagate it but this transformation and exception handling is needed here.
replies.author: gsfernandes

replies.bodyText:
But I don't get it. This information will be lost.
If you get an ExecutionExceptionWrapper exception, You will always end up throwing a new MuleRuntimeException(e.getCause())
The failureBuilder object is not referenced in the exception thrown
replies.author: lucianoRM

timeline.author: lucianoRM

replies.bodyText: No, actually the way the connector has to return a "failure" is by throwing this exception which has a an error code. If any other exception is thrown we should propagate it but this transformation and exception handling is needed here.
replies.author: gsfernandes

timeline.message: CMTS-133: If a deployment exception or lifecycle exception is thrown when creating the backed application for a design session the exceptions should be thrown instead of failures with UNKNOWN error code
